net.opentsdb.core

Class Internal

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.opentsdb.core.Internal

  • public final class Internal
extends Object
    This class is reserved for OpenTSDB's own internal usage only. If you use anything from this package outside of OpenTSDB, a dragon will spontaneously appear and eat you. You've been warned.

    This class only exists because Java's packaging system is annoying as the "package-private" accessibility level only applies to the current package but not its sub-packages, and because Java doesn't have fine-grained API visibility mechanism such as that of Scala or C++.

    This package provides access into internal methods for higher-level packages, for the sake of reducing code duplication and (ab)use of reflection.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Internal.Cell
      Represents a single data point in a row.
      static class  Internal.GetLastDataPointCB
      Callback used to fetch only the last data point from a row returned as the result of a GetRequest.
      static class  Internal.KeyValueComparator
      Helper to sort a row with a mixture of millisecond and second data points.

      • parseSingleValue

        public static Internal.Cell parseSingleValue(org.hbase.async.KeyValue column)
        Extracts a Cell from a single data point, fixing potential errors with the qualifier flags
        Parameters:
        column - The column to parse
        Returns:
        A Cell if successful, null if the column did not contain a data point (i.e. it was meta data) or failed to parse
        Throws:
        IllegalDataException - if the qualifier was not 2 bytes long or it wasn't a millisecond qualifier
        Since:
        2.0

      • extractDataPoints

        public static ArrayList<Internal.Cell> extractDataPoints(org.hbase.async.KeyValue column)
        Extracts the data points from a single column. While it's meant for use on a compacted column, you can pass any other type of column and it will be returned. If the column represents a data point, a single cell will be returned. If the column contains an annotation or other object, the result will be an empty array list. Compacted columns will be split into individual data points. Note: This method does not account for duplicate timestamps in qualifiers.
        Parameters:
        column - The column to parse
        Returns:
        An array list of data point Internal.Cell objects. The list may be empty if the column did not contain a data point.
        Throws:
        IllegalDataException - if one of the cells cannot be read because it's corrupted or in a format we don't understand.
        Since:
        2.0

      • extractDataPoints

        public static ArrayList<Internal.Cell> extractDataPoints(ArrayList<org.hbase.async.KeyValue> row,
                                                         int estimated_nvalues)
        Breaks down all the values in a row into individual Internal.Cells sorted on the qualifier. Columns with non data-point data will be discarded. Note: This method does not account for duplicate timestamps in qualifiers.
        Parameters:
        row - An array of data row columns to parse
        estimated_nvalues - Estimate of the number of values to compact. Used to pre-allocate a collection of the right size, so it's better to overshoot a bit to avoid re-allocations.
        Returns:
        An array list of data point Internal.Cell objects. The list may be empty if the row did not contain a data point.
        Throws:
        IllegalDataException - if one of the cells cannot be read because it's corrupted or in a format we don't understand.
        Since:
        2.0

      • compareQualifiers

        public static int compareQualifiers(byte[] a,
                                    int offset_a,
                                    byte[] b,
                                    int offset_b)
        Compares two data point byte arrays with offsets. Can be used on:
        • Single data point columns
        • Compacted columns
        Warning: Does not work on Annotation or other columns
        Parameters:
        a - The first byte array to compare
        offset_a - An offset for a
        b - The second byte array
        offset_b - An offset for b
        Returns:
        0 if they have the same timestamp, -1 if a is less than b, 1 otherwise.
        Since:
        2.0

      • fixQualifierFlags

        public static byte fixQualifierFlags(byte flags,
                                     int val_len)
        Fix the flags inside the last byte of a qualifier.

        OpenTSDB used to not rely on the size recorded in the flags being correct, and so for a long time it was setting the wrong size for floating point values (pretending they were encoded on 8 bytes when in fact they were on 4). So overwrite these bits here to make sure they're correct now, because once they're compacted it's going to be quite hard to tell if the flags are right or wrong, and we need them to be correct to easily decode the values.

        Parameters:
        flags - The least significant byte of a qualifier.
        val_len - The number of bytes in the value of this qualifier.
        Returns:
        The least significant byte of the qualifier with correct flags.

      • floatingPointValueToFix

        public static boolean floatingPointValueToFix(byte flags,
                                              byte[] value)
        Returns whether or not this is a floating value that needs to be fixed.

        OpenTSDB used to encode all floating point values as `float' (4 bytes) but actually store them on 8 bytes, with 4 leading 0 bytes, and flags correctly stating the value was on 4 bytes. (from CompactionQueue)

        Parameters:
        flags - The least significant byte of a qualifier.
        value - The value that may need to be corrected.

      • fixFloatingPointValue

        public static byte[] fixFloatingPointValue(byte flags,
                                           byte[] value)
        Returns a corrected value if this is a floating point value to fix.

        OpenTSDB used to encode all floating point values as `float' (4 bytes) but actually store them on 8 bytes, with 4 leading 0 bytes, and flags correctly stating the value was on 4 bytes.

        This function detects such values and returns a corrected value, without the 4 leading zeros. Otherwise it returns the value unchanged. (from CompactionQueue)

        Parameters:
        flags - The least significant byte of a qualifier.
        value - The value that may need to be corrected.
        Throws:
        IllegalDataException - if the value is malformed.

      • isFloat

        public static boolean isFloat(byte[] qualifier)
        Parses the qualifier to determine if the data is a floating point value. 4 bytes == Float, 8 bytes == Double
        Parameters:
        qualifier - The qualifier to parse
        Returns:
        True if the encoded data is a floating point value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the qualifier is null or the offset falls outside of the qualifier array
        Since:
        2.1

      • isFloat

                              int offset)
        Parses the qualifier to determine if the data is a floating point value. 4 bytes == Float, 8 bytes == Double
        Parameters:

        offset - An offset within the byte array
        Returns:
        True if the encoded data is a floating point value
        Throws:

      • extractQualifier

        public static byte[] extractQualifier(byte[] qualifier,
                                      int offset)
        Extracts the 2 or 4 byte qualifier from a compacted byte array
        Parameters:

        offset - An offset within the byte array

      • buildQualifier

        public static byte[] buildQualifier(long timestamp,
                                    short flags)
        Returns a 2 or 4 byte qualifier based on the timestamp and the flags. If the timestamp is in seconds, this returns a 2 byte qualifier. If it's in milliseconds, returns a 4 byte qualifier
        Parameters:
        timestamp - A Unix epoch timestamp in seconds or milliseconds
        flags - Flags to set on the qualifier (length &| float)
        Returns:
        A 2 or 4 byte qualifier for storage in column or compacted column
        Since:
        2.0

      • createAndSetTSUIDFilter

        public static void createAndSetTSUIDFilter(org.hbase.async.Scanner scanner,
                                           List<String> tsuids)
        Sets the server-side regexp filter on the scanner. This will compile a list of the tagk/v pairs for the TSUIDs to prevent storage from returning irrelevant rows.
        Parameters:
        scanner - The scanner on which to add the filter.
        tsuids - The list of TSUIDs to filter on
        Since:
        2.1

      • getMaxUnsignedValueOnBytes

        public static long getMaxUnsignedValueOnBytes(int width)
        Simple helper to calculate the max value for any width of long from 0 to 8 bytes.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the byte array we're comparing
        Returns:
        The maximum unsigned integer value on width bytes. Note: If you ask for 8 bytes, it will return the max signed value. This is due to Java lacking unsigned integers... *sigh*.
        Since:
        2.2

      • vleEncodeLong

        public static byte[] vleEncodeLong(long value)
        Encodes a long on 1, 2, 4 or 8 bytes
        Parameters:
        value - The value to encode
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the encoded value
        Since:
        2.4

      • rowKeyMatchsTSUID

        public static boolean rowKeyMatchsTSUID(byte[] tsuid,
                                        byte[] row_key)
        Returns true if the given TSUID matches the row key (accounting for salt and timestamp).
        Parameters:
        tsuid - A non-null TSUID array
        row_key - A non-null row key array
        Returns:
        True if the TSUID matches the row key, false if not.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the arguments are invalid.

      • getQualifier

        public static byte[] getQualifier(long timestamp,
                                  byte prefix)
        Calculates and returns the column qualifier. The qualifier is the offset of the #timestamp from the row key's base time stamp in seconds with a prefix of #PREFIX. Thus if the offset is 0 and the prefix is 1 and the timestamp is in seconds, the qualifier would be [1, 0, 0]. Millisecond timestamps will have a 5 byte qualifier.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The base timestamp.
        prefix - The prefix to set at the start of the array.
        Returns:
        The column qualifier as a byte array
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the start_time has not been set
        Since:
        2.4

      • getTimeStampFromNonDP

        public static long getTimeStampFromNonDP(long base_time,
                                         byte[] quantifier)
        Get timestamp from base time and quantifier for non datapoints. The returned time will always be in ms.
        Parameters:
        base_time - the base time of the point
        quantifier - the quantifier of the point, it is expected to be either length of 3 or length of 5 (the first byte represents the type of the point)
        Returns:
        The timestamp in ms

      • decodeHistogramDataPoint

        public static HistogramDataPoint decodeHistogramDataPoint(TSDB tsdb,
                                                          org.hbase.async.KeyValue kv)
        Decode the histogram point from the given key value
        Parameters:
        kv - the key value that contains a histogram
        Returns:
        the decoded HistogramDataPoint

      • decodeHistogramDataPoint

        public static HistogramDataPoint decodeHistogramDataPoint(TSDB tsdb,
                                                          long base_time,
                                                          byte[] qualifier,
                                                          byte[] value)
        Decode the histogram point from the given key and values
        Parameters:
        tsdb - The TSDB to use when fetching the decoder manager.
        base_time - the base time of the histogram
        qualifier - the qualifier used to store the histogram
        value - the encoded value of the histogram
        Returns:
        the decoded HistogramDataPoint
